864061061732999169.text: So they couldn’t fingerprint infected users.

864060978488639489.text: They couldn’t shut down exomemory sharing without risking public outcry. But infected implants didn’t ping Oversight.

864060684451053568.text: Customers who already had been infected were a problem, too. Neuralink was trying to contain the spread, but had little leverage.

864060373242187776.text: Who the wallet belonged to would be a task for another day. For now, all Neuralink could do was try to convince customers to upgrade.

864028691080376321.text: especially the stuttering of the victims. it was only by accident that someone figured it was a bitcoin address.

864028528936923137.text: it took a while for medical professionals to figure out what was happening.

864028212090867712.text: Long time customers went into spasms, as they had grown so reliant on their implant, the sudden loss overloaded their cerebral cortex.

864027921853423617.text: Infected customers suffered mightily for Neuralink’s oversight. Debilitating headaches, a loss of memory.

864027528310272002.text: But now it left the firm exposed.

864027469841608704.text: Originally mean to observe how people use the neural implant, the oversight system has become increasingly important for monetisation.

864027299548626944.text: One of the first things the malware did was cut the connection to Neuralink’s Oversight Server.

864027198382116868.text: Infection spread by sharing exomemories, one of the biggest selling points of the Neuralink system.

864027008585670657.text: A little digging deeper revealed that a ransomware attack had mutated, and specifically targeted Neuralinks neural implants.

864026874409824257.text: Neuralink knew something was amiss, but hardly could go out and tell people that they were monitoring them, without telling them, no less.

864026764196143104.text: It first showed up when customers stopped pinging the Oversight server.

864026594028945408.text: But their secrecy didn’t allow them to discuss the critical vulnerability present in the current implementation.

864026466052386818.text: Neuralink was getting increasingly desperate in trying to convince its customers to upgrade to the newest version of their NeuralOS software
